meta.title: Space Marines
meta.description: The Space Marines are the Emperor's Angels of Death — genetically enhanced warriors serving as humanity's ultimate defenders.

items.title: Black Templars
items.description: A zealous crusading Chapter, the Black Templars wage endless wars of faith, purging heretics and xenos in the Emperor’s name.

items.title: Blood Angels
items.description: Noble and artistic warriors cursed by the Red Thirst, the Blood Angels balance beauty and brutality in their eternal struggle.

items.title: Dark Angels
items.description: Secretive and relentless hunters of their own fallen brethren, the Dark Angels seek redemption through unending penance and war.

items.title: Deathwatch
items.description: An elite brotherhood drawn from every Chapter, the Deathwatch specializes in exterminating alien threats with surgical precision.

items.title: Grey Knights
items.description: Psyker Space Marines created to battle daemons, the Grey Knights are incorruptible paragons of purity and psychic might.

items.title: Space Wolves
items.description: Feral sons of Fenris, the Space Wolves fight with savage honor and unshakable loyalty to the Emperor.

items.title: Ultramarines
items.description: The epitome of the Codex Astartes, the Ultramarines are disciplined and strategic warriors, leading by example across the stars.

items.title: White Scars
items.description: Masters of lightning-fast assaults, the White Scars embody the spirit of the hunt, striking swiftly and disappearing before the enemy can react.

items.title: Salamanders
items.description: Forged in the fires of Nocturne, the Salamanders are resilient warriors known for their craftsmanship and compassion towards humanity.

items.title: Raven Guard
items.description: Stealthy and elusive, the Raven Guard excel in guerrilla warfare, striking from the shadows to dismantle their foes.

items.title: Iron Hands
items.description: Believing in the supremacy of machine over flesh, the Iron Hands augment their bodies with cybernetics to achieve perfection.

items.title: Imperial Fists
items.description: Unyielding defenders of the Imperium, the Imperial Fists are masters of siege warfare and fortification.

items.title: Crimson Fists
items.description: A proud successor Chapter of the Imperial Fists, the Crimson Fists are known for their resilience and indomitable spirit.

items.title: Carcharodons
items.description: Also known as the Space Sharks, the Carcharodons are fierce and relentless hunters, feared for their brutal tactics and savage nature.

items.title: Scythes of the Emperor
items.description: A mysterious Chapter known for their swift and deadly strikes, the Scythes of the Emperor are relentless in their pursuit of the Emperor's enemies.

items.title: Soul Drinkers
items.description: Once loyal servants of the Imperium, the Soul Drinkers now walk a fine line between redemption and damnation in their fight against Chaos.

items.title: Flesh Tearers
items.description: A brutal and bloodthirsty Chapter, the Flesh Tearers are known for their savage combat style and unrelenting fury in battle.

items.title: Blood Ravens
items.description: Renowned for their mysterious origins and exceptional prowess in battle, the Blood Ravens are relentless seekers of knowledge and relics.

meta.title: Imperium of Man
meta.description: The Imperium of Man spans the galaxy — a vast, theocratic empire united in worship of the God-Emperor and ruled by His immortal will.

items.title: Astra Militarum
items.description: The Imperial Guard are billions strong — ordinary humans standing against unimaginable horrors through courage and faith.

items.title: Inquisition
items.description: The Inquisition roots out heresy, witchcraft, and xenos corruption — wielding absolute authority in service to the Emperor.

items.title: Officio Assassinorum
items.description: The Emperor’s covert assassins, the Officio Assassinorum deploys deadly operatives to eliminate high-value targets with ruthless efficiency.

items.title: Adepta Sororitas
items.description: The Sisters of Battle are militant nuns of the Ecclesiarchy, wielding holy fire and faith to purge heresy from the Imperium.

items.title: Sisters of Silence
items.description: The Sisters of Silence are elite psyker-hunters, gifted with the power to nullify psychic abilities and enforce the Emperor's will.

items.title: Adeptus Custodes
items.description: The Emperor’s golden guardians, the Adeptus Custodes are near-immortal warriors who defend Terra itself.

items.title: Adeptus Mechanicus
items.description: Priests of the Machine God, the Tech-Priests of Mars fuse flesh and machine in their endless quest for technological knowledge.

items.title: Skitarii
items.description: The Skitarii are the cybernetic soldiers of the Adeptus Mechanicus, combining advanced technology with relentless discipline.

items.title: Adeptus Titanicus
items.description: Colossal war machines piloted by the Adeptus Mechanicus, Titans bring overwhelming firepower and devastation to the battlefield.

items.title: Imperial Knights
items.description: Noble pilots clad in towering war machines, the Imperial Knights bring ancient honor and devastating firepower to the battlefield.

items.title: Adeptus Arbites
items.description: The Adeptus Arbites are the Imperium's enforcers of law and order, ensuring that the Emperor's justice is upheld across the galaxy.

items.title: Death Korps of Krieg
items.description: Hardened by endless war and chemical warfare, the Death Korps of Krieg are stoic soldiers who embrace death as a path to glory.

items.title: Catachan Jungle Fighters
items.description: Survivors of the deadliest jungles, the Catachan Jungle Fighters are expert guerrilla warriors who thrive in hostile environments.

items.title: Rogue Traders
items.description: Independent explorers and merchants, Rogue Traders venture beyond the Imperium’s borders to seek fortune and forge new alliances.

meta.title: Chaos Space Marines
meta.description: Once loyal Astartes, these traitors turned to the Warp and now serve the Ruinous Powers in their eternal war against the Imperium.

items.title: Death Guard
items.description: Followers of Nurgle, the Death Guard spread disease and despair across the galaxy, unstoppable in their rotting resilience.

items.title: Thousand Sons
items.description: Once scholars and psykers, the Thousand Sons are cursed servants of Tzeentch, masters of sorcery and manipulation.

items.title: World Eaters
items.description: Devotees of Khorne, the World Eaters live for the slaughter, charging into battle with berserk fury and chainaxes raised high.

items.title: Night Lords
items.description: Masters of terror and psychological warfare, the Night Lords strike fear into the hearts of their enemies before delivering the killing blow.

items.title: Black Legion
items.description: The heirs of the Sons of Horus, the Black Legion unites countless warbands under Abaddon the Despoiler to wage the Long War against the Imperium.

items.title: Emperor's Children
items.description: Devotees of Slaanesh, the Emperor's Children pursue perfection through excess, unleashing sonic and sensory horrors on every battlefield.

items.title: Iron Warriors
items.description: Siege masters turned bitter traitors, the Iron Warriors level fortresses with ruthless artillery, trench warfare, and brutal attrition.

items.title: Word Bearers
items.description: Fanatical apostles of Chaos, the Word Bearers spread dark creed and corruption, summoning daemons and raising cults across the galaxy.

items.title: Alpha Legion
items.description: Masters of deception and sabotage, the Alpha Legion fights through subterfuge, sleeper cells, and misdirection—always several moves ahead.

items.title: Sons of Horus
items.description: Once the favored legion of the Warmaster Horus, the Sons of Horus fell to Chaos and now serve as his dark inheritors in the Long War.

meta.title: Forces of Chaos
meta.description: The forces of Chaos are the corrupted reflection of the Imperium — heretics, daemons, and traitors who worship the Dark Gods.

items.title: Khorne
items.description: The Blood God, Khorne is the embodiment of war, violence, and bloodshed, demanding constant battle and sacrifice.

items.title: Nurgle
items.description: The Plague God, Nurgle is the lord of decay, disease, and despair, offering twisted gifts of resilience and rot.

items.title: Tzeentch
items.description: The Changer of Ways, Tzeentch is the master of change, ambition, and sorcery, weaving intricate plots and schemes.

items.title: Slaanesh
items.description: The Prince of Pleasure, Slaanesh is the god of excess, indulgence, and sensation, driving followers to ever greater extremes.

items.title: Chaos Daemons
items.description: Manifestations of the Warp, the Daemons of Chaos are the living will of the Dark Gods made flesh — horror given form.

items.title: Dark Mechanicum
items.description: Renegade Tech-Priests who have turned to the worship of Chaos, the Dark Mechanicum perverts technology to serve the Ruinous Powers.

items.title: Titanicus Traitoris
items.description: Colossal war machines corrupted by Chaos, Traitor Titans bring devastating firepower and ruin to the battlefield in service to the Dark Gods.

items.title: Chaos Knights
items.description: Noble pilots clad in towering war machines, Chaos Knights bring ancient honor and devastating firepower to the battlefield in the name of Chaos.

meta.title: Xenos
meta.description: The xenos are the alien races of the galaxy — from ancient Aeldari to savage Orks, each a dire threat to mankind’s survival.

items.title: Aeldari
items.description: An ancient and dying race, the Aeldari wield psychic power and elegant technology to survive in a galaxy that has outlived them.

items.title: Drukhari
items.description: The Dark Eldar revel in pain and terror, raiding realspace from their shadowy city of Commorragh to sustain their immortal cruelty.

items.title: Tyranids
items.description: The Tyranids are a vast hive fleet of bio-engineered monsters, consuming all life in their path to fuel their endless evolution.

items.title: Genestealer Cults
items.description: Insidious infiltrators, the Genestealer Cults corrupt worlds from within before the Tyranid hive fleets descend to devour them.

items.title: Leagues of Votann
items.description: The Kin of the Leagues of Votann are hardy clonesmiths and explorers, guided by ancient ancestor cores and unbreakable bonds.

items.title: Necrons
items.description: Undying machine legions of a long-dead empire, the Necrons rise from their tomb worlds to reclaim the stars they once ruled.

items.title: Orks
items.description: Green-skinned brutes who live for war, Orks are the galaxy’s most prolific and destructive species — loud, violent, and unstoppable.

items.title: T'au Empire
items.description: United under the philosophy of the Greater Good, the T’au bring advanced technology and idealistic zeal to their growing empire.
